summary: This is the FBI Daily News Briefing for July 31, 2023, covering a wide range of national and international news, including criminal investigations, counterterrorism, and counterintelligence. It contains a brief section on the U.S. Virgin Islands using Jeffrey Epstein settlement funds for anti-trafficking initiatives and mentions a planned lawsuit by Epstein victims against the FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief news item stating the U.S. Virgin Islands is using proceeds from legal settlements related to his case to fund anti-trafficking initiatives.

persons.name: Maria Farmer
persons.context: One of two victims of Jeffrey Epstein mentioned as preparing a class-action lawsuit against the FBI for failing to investigate Epstein earlier.

persons.name: Sarah Ransome
persons.context: One of two victims of Jeffrey Epstein mentioned as preparing a class-action lawsuit against the FBI for failing to investigate Epstein earlier.

events.title: Virgin Islands Announces Anti-Trafficking Plan Funded by Epstein Settlements
events.description: The U.S. Virgin Islands announces it will use proceeds from legal settlements related to the Jeffrey Epstein case to fund new anti-trafficking initiatives.

events.title: Epstein Victims Plan Lawsuit Against FBI
events.description: Two victims of Jeffrey Epstein, Maria Farmer and Sarah Ransome, are preparing a $600 million class-action lawsuit against the FBI for failing to investigate Epstein as early as 1996.

keyFacts: The U.S. Virgin Islands is using money from Jeffrey Epstein-related legal settlements to fund anti-human trafficking programs.
The Virgin Islands is suing JPMorgan for at least $190 million, alleging the bank facilitated Epstein's sex-trafficking scheme.
Epstein victims Maria Farmer and Sarah Ransome are preparing a $600 million class-action lawsuit against the FBI for failing to investigate Epstein starting in 1996.
The document references questions about why Epstein received a lenient plea deal in 2008.
The Epstein-related content is a very small part of a broader FBI news briefing covering many other topics.
